issue.title: Add phishing domains automatic block
issue.body:
Hi!

Can you add automatic phishing links blocking?

I think the best databases (updates regularly) is:
https://phishtank.org/
https://openphish.com/
https://github.com/mitchellkrogza/Phishing.Database

It is important because TOO many phishing links not blocking by AdGuard causing a risk for your customers.

Can you please take a look into this?

comment.body:
I can't say I'm particularly amazed by when users delete their GitHub accounts in the midst of active and recently made issue reports, but sure.

Phishtank: I can't in a hurry find any full lists of the domains they block.
Openphish: I found https://openphish.com/feed.txt. which should technically be able to work in AdGuard as a standalone list, but the list seems to be trivially small.
Phishing Database: This guy seems to be onto something: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mitchellkrogza/Phishing.Database/master/phishing-domains-ACTIVE.txt . Normally I'd merrily have suggested at FiltersRegistry to add that list as a standalone, but that'd require AdGuard's regular blocking mode to properly treat raw domains, the way AdGuard DNS Blocking and uBlock Origin have done for years.

I should probably consider suggesting https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DandelionSprout/adfilt/master/Alternate%20versions%20Anti-Malware%20List/AntiMalwareAdGuard.txt on FiltersRegistry as well.

issue.title: Add phishing domains automatic block
issue.body:
Hi!

Can you add automatic phishing links blocking?

I think the best databases (updates regularly) is:
https://phishtank.org/
https://openphish.com/
https://github.com/mitchellkrogza/Phishing.Database

It is important because TOO many phishing links not blocking by AdGuard causing a risk for your customers.

Can you please take a look into this?

comment.body:
Though I personally agree to
> It is important because TOO many phishing links not blocking by AdGuard causing a risk for your customers.

, both phishtank and openphish have occaional yet sometimes-serious false positive.

> Phishtank: I can't in a hurry find any full lists of the domains they block.

There was https://github.com/tg12/pihole-phishtank-list but seems updated was stopped on Feb.
